name: trolling
content:
trolling noun [U]
(INSULTING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of leaving an insulting message on the internet in order to annoy someone: They proposed a new law on internet trolling. There are people who create several different profiles at once for the purposes of trolling.
More examplesFewer examplesI asked whether trolling hurt people. The trolling should have stopped when she requested police protection.I'm getting a bit sick of the trolling and abuse.

trolling noun [U]
(SEARCHING)
mainly US the act of searching among a large number or many different places in order to find people or information you want: This type of trolling for criminals troubles some observers. It takes me 45 minutes of trolling on the internet and I’m still confused.
More examplesFewer examplesYou get back to internet trolling at the office, while your boss is away.time spent on trolling of the aisles at discount stores

trolling noun [U]
(FISHING)
the act of trying to catch fish by pulling a baited line through the water behind a boat: Trolling is another reliable method and accounts for a surprising number of big fish. I have used my trolling rods which seem to be too heavy. See
troll
More examplesFewer examplesTrolling is a great way to catch these spread-out fish as it covers plenty of water.The rods are out and the trolling starts. Trolling is probably the easiest and most productive way to catch a trout or salmon.
